Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Olaparib Maintenance Therapy in BRCA-Mutated Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma

Trial_Design.evidence: This single-arm trial was conducted at a tertiary care center.

Participants.evidence: Eligible participants were adults with BRCA2-mutated UR-M PDAC.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention involved 8 courses of mFFX followed by 8 months of olaparib.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the efficacy of olaparib maintenance therapy following modified FOLFIRINOX (mFFX) in achieving surgical resectability.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the rate of conversion to resectable disease, assessed by imaging and surgical exploration.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and blinding were not applicable due to the single-arm design.

Blinding.evidence: Randomisation and blinding were not applicable due to the single-arm design.

Number_Randomised.evidence: One participant was enrolled and completed the intervention.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The primary tumor showed over 60% shrinkage, and hepatic metastases disappeared.

Harms.evidence: Adverse events included neuropathy due to mFFX, managed by switching to olaparib.
